question.text:
From: Facilities Department
To: All Staff
Subject: AC issues
Date: 4 February

Please be advised that an equipment contractor, Torrono Sheet Metal, is scheduled to start work on the chiller enclosure at the rear of the building tomorrow morning. The contractor will be installing a steel cover to ---1---- protect the inner workings of our heating and cooling equipment. Expect to see technicians entering and leaving the building repeatedly, carting large machine parts and tools. There will be some noise associated with this project, and we ask for your patience. ---2--- , you should probably look for on-street parking. The contractor's vans ---3---much of the driveway ---4---.

Jorge Carreras, Facilities Director

answer.explanation: Based on meaning to choose the correct answer
Based on meaning to choose the correct answer
Select (B) by this e-mail to announce what the contractor will do tomorrow morning, so the main verb of the sentence must be divided into single future tense.

choices: (A) Send us your suggestions for a new facility.
(B) I am writing to let you know about a maintenance issue.
(C) Rather, they were not my first choice for this contract.
(D) The work is expected to be completed by 2:00P.M.

answer.text: (D) The work is expected to be completed by 2:00P.M.
answer.explanation: Select (D) since the preceding statements state what the contractor does, so the last sentence can only indicate when the work is completed.

question.text:
To: Melina Ramos Sandoval
From: welcome@sourcework.ca
Date: 25 October
Subject: Registration complete

Dear Ms. Sandoval,
Welcome to the Source Work jobs network, the leading online career matching service. Your e-mail address, work experience, and preferences ---1--- in our database. This information will be used to identify employers who are seeking job candidates just like---2---. In the future, you will receive periodic notifications about open positions in your area.
---3---. Therefore, we will not share your name or address with anyone. At any point, you can select the link at the bottom of any e-mail you receive from us to unsubscribe or change your e-mail preferences.
Thank you for ---4---. If you have any questions or comments, feel free to contact us.
Sincerely,
The Source Work team

answer.explanation: Select (D) because the space immediately following the subject to which the main tense verb is to be divided and the preceding nouns indicate things as a sign of the passive voice.
Based on meaning to choose the correct answer

choices: (B) Finding the perfect job can be difficult.
(C) Our jobs database is updated weekly.
(D) Your resume has recently been reviewed.

answer.explanation: Based on meaning to choose the correct answer
Select (A) because the following sentence says they will not share her information out, so it is understandable that the previous sentence will refer to privacy.

question.text:
From : Noora Simola, Vice President of Operations
To: All Employees
Date: February 8
Re: Payroll changes

Beginning on March 15, we will be using a new payroll service that will affect a number of our current payroll processes. First, weekly payroll checks will be mailed on Thursday instead of Friday.
Direct-deposit payroll payments will also be processed a day ---1---- . Second, pay stubs for direct deposit payments will no longer bee-mailed. Instead, employees will be able to--- 2--- this information by accessing their payroll accounts online.
Other processes will remain the same. All time cards will continue to be due to the payroll department by Monday at 6:00 P.M. ---3--- . A complete, updated list of instructions for payroll procedures ----4--- to all employees on or before March 1. If you have any questions before then, please contact Leonti Belousov at ext. 5810.

answer.explanation: Based on meaning to choose the correct answer
Based on meaning to choose the correct answer

choices: (A) Please note the change of day and time.
(C) The payroll department is not operational.
(D) Old time card forms will also still be valid.

answer.text: (D) Old time card forms will also still be valid.
answer.explanation: Select (D) because the previous sentence has the phrase “time cards”

Select (B) because the subject “payroll procedures” indicates things that are signs of the passive body and considering the context on March 1 that has not yet taken place, the main verb must divide the future tense.

question.text:
Tasty Treat in Kentron
Kentron's own Groovato Gelato was founded in 2010 when Luciano Algieri, an Italian immigrant to the United States, bought a ----1--- on Coverby Avenue. The building had previously housed the Hopscotch Ice Cream Company, and Algieri was able to hire many former Hopscotch employees. Teaching ---2--- ice-cream crafters to make gelato proved to be an easy task. ---3--- his product, Algieri started with an old family recipe. He then enhanced the flavor with secret ingredients plus unusual combinations of fruits and nuts. --- 4--- . There are now three store locations in the Kentron area. Residents are lucky to have this gem!

answer.explanation: Based on meaning to choose the correct answer
Select (D) by before the noun phrase ice-cream crafters (ice cream maker) => need to enter adjectives.
Choose (A) because there is an object “his product” and the following clause indicates the purpose of the event to be entered to-V.

choices: (A) Banana walnut is slightly more expensive.
(B) Some people still prefer Hopscotch ice cream.
(C) The result is a rich and satisfying mixture of flavors.
(D) Please try a sample and give us your feedback.

answer.text: (C) The result is a rich and satisfying mixture of flavors.
answer.explanation: Choose (C) because the previous sentence said he mixes different ingredients. (combination = mixture)

question.text:
Dear PGD Account Holder,
PGD Bank strives ----1--- the highest levels of client security and service. This applies not only to online- and telephone-based services, but also to our brick-and -mortar locations. Our three branch offices have proudly been a part of the community----2--- a combined total of 40 years .
To assist you even better in the future, our Smithville branch will be temporarily closed for renovations July 8-22. ----3--- . In the meantime, our other two regional branches in Pine Grove and Bradford will maintain normal business ----4--- . We value your feedback and will respond to any concerns that you may have as soon as possible.
Sincerely,
Edwin Chen, Operations Manager
PGD Bank

answer.explanation: Choosing (A) according to the structure  “striving + to-V” means trying to do nothing.
Selecting (D) since the main verb divides the present perfect tense usually goes with for or since.

choices: (B) We thank you for trusting in PGD Bank over these years.
(C) We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.
(D) Traffic on the boulevard has increased lately.

answer.text: (C) We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.
answer.explanation: Select (C) because the previous sentence mentioned the shutdown incident so the question filled out will be an apology.
Select (A) according to the phrase "business hours" meaning working hours.

question.text: (3 September) --- Five years ago, Brian Trang signed a five-year lease to open his restaurant, Trang 's Bistro, at 30 Luray Place. Mr. Trang admits that the first two years of operation were quite ---1---."We offer spicy food from Vietnam's central region," he explains. "We didn't do well at first ---2---the cuisine is based on unfamiliar herbs and hot flavors. It took a while to catch on with customers." But Mr. Trang was confident the food would gain in popularity, and he was correct. ----3---. Mr. Trang has just signed another five-year lease, and he is planning ---- 4--- the space next year.

answer.explanation: Based on meaning to choose the correct answer
Choose (A) because the back is one the proposition indicates the cause of the matter side. Before, you need to enter a suitable conjugation.

choices: (A) Originally from Hue, Mr. Trang moved to London at age five with his family.
(B) Reservations at Trang's Bistro must now be made a week in advance.
(C) This situation was not expected to last so long.
(D) The restaurant will relocate in March.

answer.text: (B) Reservations at Trang's Bistro must now be made a week in advance.
answer.explanation: Choose (B) because previous sentence mentioned about the food popularity at Trang's Bistro so the following sentence must document this story
Choose (D) according to the plan + to-V structure means intend to do

question.text:
To: Samuel Archerson [sarcherson@vona.co.uk]
From: James Darrers [jdarrers@sky.co.uk]
Date: 10 January
Subject: Cost Accountant position

Dear Mr. Archerson,
Thank you for taking the time to meet with me today. I ----1--- our conversation, and I remain very interested in the position of cost accountant. I would welcome the opportunity to return for the third and final round of ---2---- .
I am confident my years of accounting experience would benefit your firm. As discussed, over the last ten years, I have helped many companies save a ---3---- amount of money. I am especially adept at analysing the day-to-day operations of a business and helping to determine more cost-effective methods.
I checked regarding your question about a potential start date. ---4---- . I hope to hear from you in the near future.
Sincerely,
James Darrers

answer.explanation: Select (B) because the previous sentence thanks for the time to speak, so the verb needs to divide the past simple tense.
Based on meaning  to choose the correct answer
Select (D) according to the structure: the article (a) + adjective + noun (amount of money).

choices: (A) I have four additional questions to ask you.
(B) I would be able to begin during the first week of February.
(C) I am confident I have the potential for this position.
(D) Thank you for the offer of employment.

answer.text: (B) I would be able to begin during the first week of February.
answer.explanation: Select (B) because the sentence before the phrase 'start date'

question.text: This manual provides guidelines for inventory control at Malanta facilities. Our advanced manufacturing procedures depend on ---1---- inventory control. Only by maintaining a precise flow of inventory ---2--- minimize costs and ensure prompt shipments. To achieve this goal, we must avoid shortages. When stock is in the correct location at the time it is ordered, shipments are made at regular shipping costs and within estimated time frames ---3---. Therefore, the procedures in this manual must always be faithfully ---4----.

answer.explanation: Based on meaning to choose the correct answer
Choose (D) because the beginning of a sentence has word only then the clausemust be inversion

choices: (A) We have calculated the costs for you.
(B) Please allow at least two weeks for delivery.
(C) Unfortunately, some items are currently not in stock.
(D) However, this is not possible when unexpected shortages occur.

answer.text: (D) However, this is not possible when unexpected shortages occur.
answer.explanation: Select (D) mentioned by the previous 2 sentences shortages and goods in the right place at the right time brings benefits
Based on meaning to choose the correct answer

question.text:
To: Mason Wu [mwu@wustudios.co .nz]
From: Trent Tuiloma [ttuiloma@canterburyairport.co.nz]
Subject: Canterbury Airport project
Date: Monday, 2 July

Dear Mr. Wu,
Thank you for agreeing to consult on the Canterbury Airport redesign project. ----1--- . As a result, I am particularly eager to hear your ideas about upgrading our main terminal.
Can we meet this week? There are a number of ----2--- restaurants near my office. If you are available this Friday, we could meet at Celia's Cafe on Cumberland Street. I would also like a few of my colleagues to ---3---- us. They would appreciate ---4--- ways to enhance the airport user's experience.
I look forward to hearing from you soon.
Sincerely,
Trent Tuiloma
Chairman , Canterbury Airport Redesign Team

choices: (A) I can meet you when you arrive.
(B) Scheduling flights can be quite tricky.
(C) I have long admired your work on regional airports.
(D) There are several dining options at the airport.

answer.text: (C) I have long admired your work on regional airports.
answer.explanation: Select (C) because the previous sentence has the phrase 'airport redesign project'
Select (B) because before the noun 'restaurant', an adjective is required.
Based on meaning to choose the correct answer
Select (B) because the verb 'appreciate' needs V-ing.

question.text:
To: Alan Porto [aporto@silverwing.ky]
From: Tuchman's Billing [billing@tuchmans.ky]
Subject: Autopay
Date: 19 February

Dear Mr. Porto:
Congratulations on your recent ----1--- in Tuchman's Autopay system. Thank you for signing up for this convenient billing system. answer.text: (B) You will no longer receive a bill by post.
